Authors:
Yuan-Shuai Liu, Kevin D Hyde, Jian-Kui Liu, Saisamorn
Lumyong
Title:
Xanthagaricus siamensis sp. nov. (Agaricaceae), a new dull
green lamellae mushroom from north Thailand
Keywords:
1 new species, Agaricales, Hymenagaricus, Morphology,
Phylogeny, Taxonomy
Abstract:
A new Agaricaceae species Xanthagaricus siamensis, is
discovered in Thailand and introduced herein based on morphological
features and molecular data. It is characterized by small to middle size
basidiomata, applanate to papilla pileus covered by greyish orange to
violet brown fibrillose-squamules, white to dark green lamellae with
age, white stipe covered by violet brown squamules, lamellae and stipe
change from white to pinkish white when injured, white membranous and
inconspicuous annulus, ellipsoid to oblong basidiospores and cutis
pileipellis. Phylogenetic analyses based on the internal transcribed
spacer (ITS) region and the large subunit (LSU) of the nuclear ribosomal
DNA also support to identify it as a new species in Xanthagaricus.
Illustrations of macro- and micromorphological characters, descriptions
and phylogenetic placement of X. siamensis are provided.
